excerpt: Possibly dating from 6th century B.C., this 3-storey temple is one of the holiest devoted to Shiva.
detail_description: Nestled in the historic city of Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh, the Shri Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga Temple stands as a revered sanctuary dedicated to Lord Shiva. Dating back to possibly the 6th century B.C., this three-story temple is one of India's twelve Jyotirlingas and holds immense spiritual significance for Hindu pilgrims.
name: Shri Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga Temple
address: inside Mahankal Mandir, Jaisinghpura, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456001, India

excerpt: Hindu temple dedicated to the guardian deity of the city where the common offering is liquor.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Ujjain, the Shri Kaal Bhairav Temple stands as a vibrant testament to Hindu devotion and culture. This sacred site is dedicated to Lord Kaal Bhairav, a fierce manifestation of Lord Shiva and revered as the city's guardian deity. A unique aspect of this temple is its ritualistic offering of liquor, symbolizing devotees' surrendering of their vices to the divine.
name: Shri Kaal Bhairav Temple, Ujjain
address: Bhairavgarh, Goyala Buzurg, Madhya Pradesh 456003, India

detail_description: Ram Ghat Marg is the focal point of Ujjain's river ghats, adorned with colorful shrines and bustling with activity as people bathe in the Shipra river and offer gifts. The atmosphere is particularly enchanting at dawn and dusk, when devotees play cymbals, light candles, and engage in religious rituals. During festivals, the ghat becomes a vibrant hub of religious fervor as crowds flock to the river to partake in spiritual ceremonies.
name: Ram Ghat Marg
address: Kartik Chowk, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

detail_description: Located in Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh, Maharishi Sandipani Ashram is a revered shrine situated on the banks of the Kshipra River. It is known as a significant center of worship and is believed to be the place where Lord Krishna received his education in 64 different fields of study. The ashram also features beautiful paintings depicting the life of Lord Krishna.
name: Maharishi Sandipani Ashram
address: Maharshri sandipani aashram, Sri Sarveshwar Mahadeva Temple, Mangalnath Marg, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

excerpt: Ancient Hindu cave complex & pilgrimage site set adjacent to the banks of the Shipra River.
detail_description: Nestled along the serene banks of the Shipra River, the Bhartrihari Caves are a captivating ancient rock-hewn complex located in Ujjain's tranquil suburbs. Estimated to be over 2000 years old, these caves pay homage to the revered poet and philosopher Bhartrihari, who is said to have meditated here for twelve years after renouncing worldly desires.
name: Bhartrihari caves
address: 6Q38+JJQ, Barnagar Road, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

excerpt: Palatial Hindu temple devoted to Krishna featuring landscape gardens, marble pillars & a veranda.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Ujjain, the ISKCON Temple is a magnificent tribute to Lord Krishna, showcasing stunning architecture crafted from exquisite marble. The temple grounds are adorned with lush landscape gardens and vibrant flowers that create an enchanting atmosphere, inviting visitors to experience divine serenity. A highlight of this sacred site is its Goshala, where cows are lovingly cared for, reflecting the temple's commitment to compassion and spirituality.
name: ISKCON Temple, Ujjain
address: Hare Krishna Land, 33-37, Administrative Zone, Bharatpuri, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456010, India

detail_description: ChintaHaran Ganesh Temple, also known as Bada Ganesh Mandir, is a revered Hindu temple in Ujjain dedicated to Lord Ganesh. It is located near the Mahakal Jyotirlinga and is considered one of the ancient and famous temples in the city. The temple attracts many visitors and devotees who come to seek blessings from Lord Ganesha. It's recommended to plan for parking ahead of time due to the high number of visitors.
name: ChintaHaran Ganesh Temple
address: 5QQG+5FX, Madanlal Sharma Marg, Musaddipura, Kharakua Colony, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

detail_description: When in Ujjain, a visit to the Harsiddhi Devi Temple is a must. This ancient temple houses a painted idol of Annapurna, adorned in dark red, flanked by idols of Mahalaxmi and Mahasaraswati. It holds great significance as the Kuldevi of King Vikramaditya. The temple exudes an energetic religious ambiance, especially during the Sandhya Aarti.
name: Harsiddhi Devi Temple
address: 5QM7+QVV, Jaisinghpura, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

excerpt: Platform/steps for Hindu ceremonies & pilgrimage destination for holy baths in the Shipra River.
detail_description: Nestled along the serene banks of the Shipra River, Shri Ram Ghat is a revered pilgrimage destination that draws countless Hindu devotees and curious travelers alike. This sacred site is not only famous for its spiritual ambiance but also serves as a platform for various Hindu ceremonies and holy baths. The ghat holds immense significance as it hosts the renowned Kumbh Mela every 12 years, attracting pilgrims from all over India.
name: Shri Ram Ghat
address: 5QP7+CHX, Ram Ghat Marg, Kartik Chowk, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

excerpt: Imposing 2-story place of worship with carved pillars & colorful, flower-bedecked shrines.
detail_description: Shri Chaubis Khamba Mata Temple in Ujjain is an impressive 2-story place of worship adorned with intricately carved pillars and vibrant, flower-bedecked shrines. Dating back to the late 9th century, this sacred site boasts a magnificent entrance gate known as the Mahakala-Vana. The temple is dedicated to Chhoti Mata and Badi Mata and features captivating images of guardian goddesses Mahalaya and Mahamaya at the entrance.
name: Shri Chaubis Khamba Mata Temple, Ujjain
address: 24, Gudri Chouraha, Jaisinghpura, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

excerpt: Prayer halls with ornate, carved gopuram gates, a shrine with an eternal lamp & Maratha-era origins.
detail_description: Shree Harsiddhi Mata Shaktipeeth Temple, located near Rudra Sagar Lake in Ujjain, is a visually stunning complex with ornate prayer halls and Maratha-era origins. The temple features two cone-shaped Light Pillars adorned with oil lamps, a distinctive architectural element of Maratha temples.
name: Shree Harsiddhi Mata Shaktipeeth Temple
address: Harsiddhi Marg, Harsiddhi Chauraha, Jaisinghpura, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

excerpt: Ujjain is an ancient city beside the Kshipra River in the central Indian state of Madhya Pradesh. An important Hindu pilgrimage destination, itâ€™s known for the centuries-old Mahakaleshwar Temple, a towering structure with a distinctively ornate roof. Nearby, Bade Ganesh Temple houses a colorful statue of Ganesh, the elephant-headed Hindu deity. Harsiddhi Temple features a pair of tall dark pillars studded with lamps.
detail_description: Ujjain, located in the central Indian state of Madhya Pradesh, is a city steeped in ancient history and spirituality. Situated beside the Kshipra River, it is renowned as a significant Hindu pilgrimage destination. The city is home to several notable temples, including the Mahakaleshwar Temple with its strikingly ornate roof and the Bade Ganesh Temple which houses a vibrant statue of the elephant-headed deity, Ganesh.
name: Ujjain
address: Madhya Pradesh, India

detail_description: Vikram Kirti Mandir, located in Ujjain, is a museum and cultural center dedicated to King Vikramaditya. It offers visitors a glimpse into the rich history and heritage of the region through its collection of ancient scriptures, sculptures, relics, coins, and manuscripts. The museum also houses an art gallery and serves as a research center for Indian culture.
name: Vikram Kirti Mandir
address: 5R92+77M, Rishi Nagar, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456010, India

detail_description: Located a short distance from Ujjain, the Shri Mangalnath Temple is situated near the banks of the Shipra River. It is believed to be the birthplace of Mars according to Hindu mythology and has been historically significant for astronomical observations. The temple is dedicated to Mahadeva and also houses a shrine for Dharati Mata, mother of Mars. Visitors come here seeking positive vibes and peace, as well as to alleviate any perceived negative influences associated with Mars.
name: Mangalnath Temple
address: Mangalnath Marg, near Sandipani Ashram, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

detail_description: When in the sacred city of Ujjain, a visit to Shree Bada Ganesh Mandir is a must. This revered Hindu shrine is home to one of the largest idols of Lord Ganesha, standing at 18 ft tall and 10 ft wide. Situated near the Mahakaleshwar Temple, it also features a statue of Hanuman that predates the idol of Lord Ganesha. The temple's spiritual ambiance and impressive architecture attract both devotees and tourists.
name: Shree Bada Ganesh Mandir
address: 5QM8+FXG, inside Mahakal Mandir, Jaisinghpura, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

excerpt: Stately, 19th-century temple with a silver-coated Krishna idol & surrounded by street-market stalls.
detail_description: Gopal Mandir, located in Ujjain, is a 19th-century temple dedicated to Lord Krishna. The shrine showcases Maratha architecture and features a silver-coated idol of Krishna on a marble-inlaid altar with silver-plated doors. Situated in the midst of a bustling market square, the temple offers visitors an opportunity to explore its religious and historical significance while being surrounded by street-market stalls.
name: Shri Dwarkadhish Gopal Mandir Ujjain
address: Mahakaal Temple, Patni Bazar, Kamri Marg, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

detail_description: Siddhavat Ghat is a revered site in Ujjaini, boasting an ancient banyan tree that is believed to be over 2000 years old and holds mystical powers. According to the Avantika section of Skanda Purana, this sacred tree was planted by Mother Goddess Parvati herself and has great significance as it is where she prepared kheer for Kartikeya.
name: Siddhavat Ghat
address: 6QFG+PJ9, MP SH 17, Ganesh Nagar, Madhya Pradesh 456003, India

excerpt: Possibly dating from 6th century B.C., this 3-storey temple is one of the holiest devoted to Shiva.
detail_description: Nestled in Ujjain, the Mahakaleshwar Temple stands as a revered sanctuary dedicated to Lord Shiva. It is home to one of the twelve Jyotirlingas, emitting an atmosphere of sanctity and serenity. Pilgrims flock here to receive blessings and partake in the captivating Bhasma Aarti ceremony, which transcends earthly realms.
name: Shri Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga Temple
address: inside Mahankal Mandir, Jaisinghpura, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456001, India

name: Chhote Gopal Mandir Ujjain
address: Tatya Tope Marg, Madhav Nagar, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

detail_description: Ram Janardan Temple, located in Ujjain, India, is a historic and spiritually significant site dedicated to Lord Ram and Janardan. The temple showcases beautiful architecture with intricate carvings and ancient artistry. Built in the 17th century by Mirza Raja Jaisingh, it is situated near Sandipani Ashram and holds a unique concept where the idols of Ram and Laxman are depicted walking while Sita stops Ram with folded hands.
name: Ram Janardan Temple
address: 6Q6H+2G9, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

detail_description: Navgrah Shani Mandir Ujjain is located in the Dedhiya region, about 8 km from Ujjain, at the confluence of Kshipra, Gandaki, and Saraswati rivers. The temple is dedicated to the nine planets and features idols for Surya, Chandra, Mangal, Budh, Guru, Shukra, Rahu, Ketu and Shani.
name: Navgrah Shani Mandir Ujjain
address: Motibagh Colony, Ujjain, Dhediya, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

detail_description: The Government Jiwaji Observatory in Ujjain has a rich history in the field of astronomy, with significant works such as the Surya Siddhanta and the PanchSiddhanta being written there. It is believed that the Tropic of Cancer crosses through this observatory according to Indian astronomers. Visitors, including students, geography and astronomy enthusiasts, and regular tourists, can spend an entire day exploring this fascinating place.
name: Government Jiwaji Observatory
address: 5QC8+GH4, Jabsinghpura, Gavughat, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456010, India

detail_description: Nestled along the serene banks of the Shipra River at Triveni Ghat, Shree Navagraha Mandir is a revered temple dedicated to the nine celestial bodies in Hindu astronomy. This sacred site attracts numerous devotees, especially on new moon Saturdays when followers seek blessings from Shani Dev, known for his protective nature towards the righteous and his punitive stance against wrongdoers.
name: Shree Navagraha Mandir
address: 5QM9+49Q, inside Mahankal Mandir, Jaisinghpura, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456001, India

excerpt: Museum of ancient art & culture showcasing many religious idols, sculptures & antiques.
detail_description: Triveni Museum, located near Rudra Sagar in Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh, is a treasure trove of ancient art and culture. The museum showcases religious idols, sculptures, and antiques that reflect the city's rich heritage. Divided into sections dedicated to different eras in Ujjain's history, the museum features Shaivayan (Shaiva gallery), Krishayan (Vaishnav gallery), and Durgayan (Shakti gallery) exhibits.
name: Triveni Museum
address: 43-44, Hari Phatak Over Bridge, Keshav Nagar, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456010, India

excerpt: 18th-century observatory with operational vintage astronomical devices, including a sundial.
detail_description: Jantar Mantar in Ujjain is an 18th-century observatory established by Savai Raja Jay Singh, featuring vintage astronomical devices like the Samrat Yantra and Digansha Yantra. This historical site serves as an equinoctial sundial, aiding in time detection and celestial body positioning. It stands as evidence of Ujjain's long-standing reputation as an educational hub.
name: Jantar Mantar, Ujjain
address: Chintaman Rd, Jabsinghpura, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456010, India

detail_description: Ujjain Junction is a significant railway station in India that is well connected to other major stations across the country. It boasts cleanliness and good maintenance, although it may have fewer platforms due to its religious significance. The waiting room accommodates a limited number of people, around 20 to 25, and unfortunately, the male passengers tend to occupy the ladies waiting room. Outside the station, visitors can enjoy breathtaking views of Avantika, Shivling, and the Parrot Tree.
name: Ujjain Junction
address: Malipura, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456001, India

excerpt: Pilgrim temple constructed of red-hued marble, with steps leading to the river for prayers to Shiva.
detail_description: Mangalnath Mandir is a unique red-hued marble temple located on the northern outskirts of Ujjain, near the Kshipra river. It is considered the birthplace of Mangal (Mars) planet and is often referred to as the 'navel of India' due to its significant geographical location. The temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva and hosts special worship rituals, including the Bhat Puja offering.
name: Mangalnath Mandir
address: Ankpat Marg, Mangalnath Mandir, Agar Rd, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456010, India

detail_description: Bharat Mata Temple in Ujjain is a remarkable symbol of national pride and unity. The temple features an idol of Bharat Mata and showcases a marble map of India, honoring the country's diverse cultural heritage. Its impressive architecture and serene atmosphere make it an inspiring place for reflection and prayer. Dedicated to Mother India, the temple exudes patriotism and devotion, drawing visitors from near and far to admire its beauty.
name: Bharat Mata Temple, Ujjain
address: 5QJ9+8MX, Jaisinghpura, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456001, India

detail_description: Nagarkot Ki Rani Temple, also known as Vikram Kirti Mandir, is a modern architectural marvel in Ujjain dedicated to King Vikramaditya. The temple's stunning design and elaborate decorations on its entrance gate make it a cultural landmark. It serves as an homage to the legendary king, showcasing his historical significance. Additionally, the site was once the residence of Rani Durgavati and offers a glimpse into Ujjain's royal heritage.
name: Nagarkot Ki Rani Temple, Ujjain
address: Durga nagar nagarkot, Madhya Pradesh 456010, India

detail_description: Tower Chowk in Ujjain is a lively commercial center that seamlessly blends tradition with modern commerce. It's famous for its energetic street food vendors, locally made crafts, and reasonably priced clothing. This bustling market offers a great opportunity to immerse yourself in the daily rhythm of life in Ujjain while enjoying some affordable retail therapy.
name: Tower Chowk
address: Madhav Nagar, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh, India

detail_description: Bhairav Temple, located on the serene banks of River Shipra, is said to have been built by King Bhadrasen. This sacred site is dedicated to Bhairav, a manifestation of Lord Shiva in Hindu mythology. The temple holds historical and religious significance and attracts devotees seeking blessings and spiritual experiences.
name: Bhairav temple
address: 75, Kajipura, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

detail_description: Mahakal Lok Corridor Rd in Ujjain is a project aimed at enhancing tourism and preserving ancient heritage while offering modern amenities to pilgrims. Stretching over 900 meters, the corridor is set against the backdrop of the historic Rudrasagar Lake, which is also part of this development initiative.
name: Mahakal Lok Corridor Rd
address: Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh, India

detail_description: Mahakal Lok in Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh is a divine site near the Mahakaleshwar temple. It features a 900-meter long corridor with stunning architecture and thematic lighting that creates a magical experience, especially at night. The corridor showcases intricate sculptures depicting stories of Lord Shiva and offers a serene atmosphere with the nearby Rudrasagar Lake. Visitors praise the well-maintained and organized space, which replaces crowded lanes and provides a clean environment for pilgrims.
name: Mahakal Lok
address: Bagambag Colony, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456001, India

detail_description: The Ujjain Planetarium, also known as Vikram Kirti Mandir, is a must-visit for families and astronomy enthusiasts. It offers educational programs on space, astronomy, and the universe through interactive exhibits and regular 3D shows like 'Interstellar'. Although Smart City work is ongoing in the area, visitors can still enjoy the immersive experience of watching movies on a 360-degree screen that simulates the night sky.
name: Ujjain Planetarium | Most advanced Planetarium in central India
address: MPCST Planetarium, Antariksha Parisar, Sector C, Vasant Vihar, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456010, India

detail_description: The Ram Mandir in Ujjain is a significant religious site and a dharamshala, providing shelter for pilgrims. Located near the Harsiddhi Mata Mandir, it offers a serene space for spiritual reflection and relaxation. The temple features captivating images of Shri Ram, Lakshman, and Janaki ji, as well as a nearby temple dedicated to Tulsidas ji. Visitors can witness people taking holy dips at the ancient bathing ghats nearby and enjoy breathtaking sunsets.
name: Ram Mandir
address: 5QPH+PFX, Ksheer Sagar, Malipura, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

detail_description: Ramghat Marg is a prominent religious destination located in Ujjain, featuring a ghat built along the banks of the Shipra River. It holds great significance and is considered a must-visit site for anyone exploring Ujjain.
name: Ramghat Marg
address: Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

name: Ujjain Bus Stand Malipura Ujjain
address: Bus Stand, Malipura, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

detail_description: Atal Park, located in the vibrant city of Ujjain near the Nanakheda area, is a serene oasis that beautifully blends relaxation and recreation. Named after the esteemed former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee, this park is a haven for families and individuals alike. With its lush greenery and well-maintained landscape, visitors can enjoy various amenities including fitness equipment suitable for all ages, from children to seniors.

detail_description: Nestled just 4 kilometers from the bustling heart of Ujjain, Vishnu Sagar Taalab is a captivating reservoir steeped in history and spirituality. This serene lake, believed to have been constructed during the 11th century under the Paramara dynasty, is not only a picturesque spot but also an important pilgrimage site due to its proximity to the revered Mahakaleshwar Temple.
name: Vishnu Sagar Taalab, Ujjain
address: Mangalnath Marg, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

detail_description: Gadkalika mandir Puja shop is a peaceful and sacred Hindu temple located in Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh. It's one of the must-visit places in Ujjain Darshan and is situated near Bhartrihari Caves. This temple holds significance as the 6th Ashtadasha Shakthipeeth, dedicated to Ma Kali, a powerful form of Matha Parvathi.
name: Gadkalika mandir Puja shop
address: 6Q5C+843, Urdupura, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

detail_description: The Angareshwar Mahadev Temple in Ujjain is a revered site dedicated to Lord Shiva, located beside the Shipra River. Despite its spiritual significance, some visitors have noted poor management and crowded conditions at the temple. However, it is still considered one of the best temples in the city and is known for its effective mangal dosha puja and as a designated origin place of Mangal Grah.
name: Angareshwar Mahadev Mandir, Ujjain (43/84)
address: mandir, Angareshwar Mahadev(43/84), Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

detail_description: Mangalnath Setu is a serene temple situated in a peaceful location, away from the city's commotion. Accessible via a winding path, it offers stunning views of the Shipra waters, creating a tranquil atmosphere for visitors. According to the Matsya Purana, this temple is believed to be the birthplace of Mars, adding an intriguing mythological aspect to its allure.
name: Mangalnath Setu
address: Madhya Pradesh, India

detail_description: Ujjain has a rich historical significance dating back to the times of Mahabharat and Ramayana. Legend has it that Lord Rama and Maa Sita used to visit for performing Pind Daan for King Dashrat at Ramghat. It was also revered as a sacred pilgrimage destination and was once the residence of Emperor Ashoka, adding to its historical allure.
name: History of ujjain
address: 175 triveni hills, goylakhurd, opp. hotel anjushree, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

detail_description: Shri Chintaharan Ganesh Mandir, the largest Ganesh temple in Ujjain, is a must-visit attraction near the Mahakaleshwar Temple. The temple houses a remarkable idol of the main deity Shri Ganesh along with his consorts Riddhi and Siddhi. It is renowned for its unique and extraordinary statue of Lord Ganesh. Located in close proximity to the Commissioner's bungalow, this religious site is known for its beautiful architecture and spiritual significance.
name: Shri Chintaharan Ganesh Mandir
address: 5QHP+8RH, Madhav Nagar, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

detail_description: If you're fascinated by history and archaeology, a visit to Dr. V.S. Wakankar Sangrahalaya in Ujjain is a must. Named after the renowned Indian archaeologist Vishnu Shridhar Wakankar, this museum houses a remarkable collection of artifacts from the Indus Valley and Harappan civilizations discovered during excavations. It also preserves rare handwritten ancient manuscripts and books authored by Dr. V.S.
name: Dr. V.S. Wakankar Sangrahalaya
address: 13, Narayanpura Saver Rd, Santram Sindhi Colony, Sant Nagar, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456010, India

detail_description: Rumi ka Maqbara is a stunning mausoleum located in Aurangabad, India. It is often referred to as the 'Taj of the Deccan' due to its striking resemblance to the iconic Taj Mahal. The mausoleum was built in the late 17th century by Aurangzeb's son in memory of his mother, Rabia-ul-Daurani.
name: 5QW9+6VM
address: Urdupura, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

detail_description: Shri Nandi Dwar, also known as the Nandi Gateway, is a grand entrance to the Mahakal Lok Corridor near the Ujjain Mahakal Temple. It is one of two majestic gateways, along with Pinaki Dwar, that mark the beginning of the journey into the corridor. The name 'Nandi Dwar' pays homage to Lord Shiva's sacred bull companion and symbolizes power and righteousness.
name: Shri Nandi Dwar / à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥€ à¤¨à¤‚à¤¦à¥€ à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤°
address: 5QGC+G57, Begampura, Bagambag Colony, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456001, India

detail_description: Jay Maa Pavagadh Shakti Peeth is a popular pilgrimage site where visitors can pay their respects and seek blessings. It is a serene and beautiful place to visit, especially in the morning. The atmosphere is filled with devotion as people chant 'Jai Mata Di' while exploring the surroundings.
name: Jay Maa Pavagadh Shakti Peeth
address: 23, neelganga yantra Mahal Marg, kanchan vihar, Neelganga Rd, kanchan Vihar Colony, Sindhi Colony, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456010, India

excerpt: Freeganj is the most affluent and expensive area of Ujjain, the fourth largest city in the Indian state of Madhya Pradesh. Freeganj is known for its education hub. There is a park known as "Shaheed Park" in its center. It has many coaching institutes for IIT-JEE, Medical and School Coaching. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Freeganj, located in Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh, is renowned as the most upscale and costly neighborhood in the area. It is recognized for being an educational center with numerous coaching institutes catering to various fields such as IIT-JEE, Medical, and School Coaching. The district also features a central park called 'Shaheed Park,' adding a touch of greenery to its urban landscape.
name: Freeganj
address: Madhav Nagar, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh, India

detail_description: Nanakheda is a charming destination with a lot to offer. The area is known for its beautiful landscapes and serene atmosphere, making it the perfect place to unwind and relax. Visitors can explore the local culture and traditions, as well as indulge in delicious cuisine. Whether you're interested in outdoor activities or simply want to take in the natural beauty, Nanakheda has something for everyone.
name: Nanakheda
address: Rishi Nagar, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456010, India
